primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from fear/blindness caused by physical threats (iron chariots) to victory/peace through spiritual vision (chariots of fire).

object.identificatie: Victory over life's 'iron chariots' (hardships, sickness, death) and spiritual vision.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / The Tribe of Joseph
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject who must 'drive out' the enemy but is also the Receiver of vision.

helper.identificatie: Faith, Spiritual Vision, and the 'Angels/Chariots of Fire'

helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily the Helper (instrumentalized as the power behind the vision) rather than the active Subject of the struggle.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help/protection ('Angels keep watching over me').

sickness and separation, and at last there will be death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent includes the 'unassailable fact' of death and the 'flood of mortal ills,' requiring more than human effort to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical/physical mandate to work and conquer the material world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Manasseh/Ephraim)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Cutting down the wood/driving out Canaanites
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon argues that spiritual vision (Primary) is the necessary condition for physical endurance (Secondary).

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is Gnostic-leaning; the primary lack is not 'power' but 'vision' (knowing/seeing). Once the Subject 'sees' the fire, the 'iron' loses its power.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Iron Chariots) to ~S1 (Blindness/Fear) to S1 (Vision/Fire), while explicitly rejecting ~S2 (Ghost Christianity).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'opening of eyes' which reveals that S1 has always surrounded S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The preacher emphasizes that death and iron chariots are 'unassailable facts' to the natural eye.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses strong 'Grace' language (God opening eyes), the actantial Subject remains the human who must 'drive out' the enemy. God is the environment/helper rather than the primary Actor in the struggle.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: thou shalt drive out the Canaanites... you will overcome

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The LORD opened the eyes of the young man

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Joshua and Elisha are presented as models of 'faith' that the hearer should emulate to achieve the same vision.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how God, despite Israel's lack of chariots, sovereignly cleared the mountain to fulfill His covenant.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Encouragement to 'see' so that they can 'do'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Faith is treated as a 'resource' or 'tool' for the human subject to manage life.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon successfully links the OT narratives to modern psychological/physical struggles, but the transition from 'God opens eyes' to 'Man drives out' creates a synergistic tension.
spanning_punten: The command to 'drive out' vs. the reality of 'chariots of fire' doing the protecting.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The mountain was full of horses and chariots of fire... more than conquerors.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides 'Savoir' (Vision) which then enables the human 'Pouvoir'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon has a strong 'Savoir-faire' (knowing/seeing) focus. The human is the Subject of the struggle, and God is the Helper/Environment.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is told 'you shall drive out' the iron chariots.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject of the 'driving out'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You will drive out the Canaanites because you see the fire,' use 'The God of the fiery chariots has already claimed the mountain; He drives out the iron before Him.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Identifying with Joshua's 'choice spirit' or Elisha's 'faith'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the servant did nothing but receive sight; the chariots were there regardless of his faith.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Shift from 'how we see' to 'what God does' regardless of our sight.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The preacher already takes the 'iron' of the world seriously.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (driving out enemies) often obscures the 'Primary' (God's deliverance).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Order: 1. God's Presence (Fire) → 2. God's Victory → 3. Our Rest/Inheritance.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and takes the 'iron' of life seriously. To move from 'Mixed' to 'Grace', focus less on the hearer's 'resource of faith' and more on the 'Object of faith' who acts even when we are blind.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is an 'encouragement'. Actantially, it is a 'recruitment' of the human subject to use divine tools.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the tribal boundaries; Greimas shows the sermon is actually about the 'modal competence' of vision.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Faith' is being treated as a 'Helper' (instrument) rather than a gift, which risks making the sermon anthropocentric.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Romans 8 at the end to pivot toward a more theocentric conclusion, which mitigates some of the earlier moralism.
